name: Loews Hollywood Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in a family sized junior suite.
reviews.title: Brilliant staff. Great room. Excellent location. Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in, which was friendly and professional, we were assigned a room. Unfortunately, the room didn't suit so I went back to the reception and asked for assistance. The response was fantastic, they assigned us to another room which was perfect.
reviews.title: Great location, good breakfast, average hotel

reviews.text: I cannot rave about the staff more (Carolyn Hart, you are a star⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️). They were more than happy to help with anything.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.text: The room was perfect.
reviews.title: Loews Hollywood Hotel

reviews.text: Brilliant location. Fantastic room amenities. Everything was obviously near new as the renovations are close to complete.
reviews.title: Nice stay and good central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved staying here. Right on Hollywood Blvd close to restaurants, shops and tours. Our room on the 16th floor had a great view of the famous Hollywood sign. We loved the location and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hollywood.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in a Deluxe King room. The staff, restaurants and price are great. The location is perfect for walking or cabbing. So easy to take tours from property. Very nice fitness area, and the heated pool is great.
reviews.title: Glad we chose hotel.

reviews.text: I flew into Hollywood, California for less than 24 hours to catch a show at the Hollywood Bowl. This hotel was in the perfect location for me. It was walking distance to the tourist spots (stars on the sidewalk, Dolby Theatre, etc.) and it was walking distance to the Hollywood Bowl. The rooms were stunning, clean, quiet and the beds were very comfortable. It felt like being home. I would definitely stay here again. PS. I could see the HOLLYWOOD sign from my room. That was pretty cool :)
reviews.title: Perfect spot in the middle of everything!

reviews.text: The hotel is overpriced for a 3 star hotel. The location is only convenient to the walk of fame and that's it. They are far from everywhere and need transportation Yo have to drive every where. Even when you walk down to the walk of fame, you get hustled every five meters so just keep to to yourself.
reviews.title: Way Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The butlers were extremely rude upon arrival and reception charge my credit card told me that we cosider your platinum vis credit card a debit card. Doesn't make sense.
reviews.title: Perfect after a long flight

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in deluxe double room.
reviews.title: Excellent location, fair for everything else

reviews.text: Side entrance on mezzanine level opens to 2nd floor of Hollywood & Highland Centre, where Dolby Theatre is located. We accessed the hotel from Hollywood Boulevard through this door instead of entrance along N Highland. Felt safer.
reviews.title: The best location

reviews.text: Superb location, perfect for all that we planned to do in Hollywood as below:
reviews.title: Not the best in the neighborhood

reviews.text: 1) Movie at El Capitan Theatre - located right across H&H Centre so my worries about safety getting back to hotel with kids in tow after the show ended past 9pm was unwarranted. Watched 7pm Frozen movie. For guaranteed seating, book online in advance.
reviews.title: A good choice for Hollywood

reviews.text: 2) Universal Studios - Metro station is right at H&H Centre. One-way ride to Universal City station costs $1.50. The Tap card, onto which you add the value/fare required for the trips, costs $1.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel is currently renovating its lobby so you can't enter from its Maine entrance but it did not impact on our stay. It is very conveniently located in the heart of Hollywood right next to the Dolby theatre and the highland shopping centre. This would be the best choice if this is your first time ink Los Angeles and you are not driving. This is because the heart is in a convenient location where by taxi it is around 10-20 mins taxi to most places in Los Angeles such as downtown, warner brothers, Griffith observatory, Beverly Hills, universal etc. However, if you are going to have a car in Los Angeles, and it will be convenient for you to get around by yourself, Hollywood the area it self is extremely touristy and not the best place to be at night as there are plenty of weirdos hanging around. It's not considered a great area to locals, just touristy, convenient but no locals are around and don't like to be around there. However as a tourist it is definitely a convenient location.
reviews.title: Great hotel with central location if you don't have a car.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is big, comfortable and clean. Front desk upgraded our room to a view room because we were able to join the Loews hotel member for free. The view was amazing with the Hollywood sign just outside of our window and a view of the entire east LA including the whole of downtown. The bed was extremely comfortable win very soft bed sheets. Front desk wasn't great at answering local questions though nod the concierge service was a lot better at night than in the afternoon as some of the information they told us was wrong. Such as I asked where I can find a SIM card, concierge told us the pharmacy but the pharmacy said they don't have. However the man at night was a lot better and attentive and detailed.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better location or more comfortable beds!

reviews.text: After a long flight and with our three kids in tow, we checked into Loews and it was quick and efficient. Beds were very very comfortable and we were given rooms overlooking the hollywood sign - excellent. The hotel is walking distance to hollywood blvd and Graumans Chinese Theatre and is connected to these by a good mall with Sephora, Lids, Fossil and other good names.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, in a question mark area

reviews.text: Breakfast is ample and delicious and staff are always friendly and make sure you're happy. Would stay there again in a heartbeat - with or without kids.
reviews.title: Great panoramic view of LA

reviews.text: So this Loews sits on Hollywood blvd. the hotel in under a huge rehab. If you stay here make sure to get a rehabbed room. The lobby has been relocated to the mezzanine. The hotel does have a hertz counter so we rented a car at LAX and returned it to the hotel without a drop off charge. The rehab room we had was really lovely, good pillows, bed and towels. Sound between the rooms is pretty loud. The room next to us could be heard talking on what appeared to the phone as we only heard half of the conversation. The desk staff was not particularly friendly. We came back to the hotel one night to find the line for the elevator going thru the lobby.....American idol contestants.....I spoke to the concierge wasn't there another way to get up stairs and he said no.......we were not happy. We had a good enough buffet breakfast. Hollywood blvd seems unsafe after dark and we saw no police presence.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel right near Hollywood Blvd

description: The Hollywood sign. The Hills. The Academy Awards. Jimmy Kimmel Live. The Hollywood Walk of Fame. The city’s major movie studios. This is the stuff a classic visit to Hollywood is made of—and a stay at Loews Hollywood Hotel puts you right in the middle of all the action. Whether it’s sightseeing, business or relaxation that brings you here, our 632 guestrooms and suites are the perfect place to unwind after a day in L.A.Just outside our doors is the expansive Hollywood & Highland Center—a hive of activity where you can shop, eat, hang out or host an event at the Dolby Theatre, home of the Academy Awards, with catering by Wolfgang Puck. We count Jimmy Kimmel’s studio as our neighbor and we’re close to the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood Bowl.Our recently refreshed rooms have some of the best views in the city—choose from postcard-perfect views of the Hollywood sign, the Capitol Records building or the L.A. city skyline. When you’re ready for a little me time, head to our hotel’s rooftop pool and deck, or to the Exhale Spa for a spa treatment or yoga class.
